akn:section.akn:heading: Limitation on power of Conference to impose new obligations on United States

akn:content.akn:p: § 279d. Limitation on power of Conference to impose new obligations on United States In adopting this subchapter the Congress does so with the understanding that paragraph 2 of article XIII does not authorize the Conference of the Organization to so modify the provisions of its Constitution as to involve any new obligation for the United States. (July 31, 1945, ch. 342, § 5, 59 Stat. 530.)
